intro: Pentacalia almorzana, commonly known as the morning glory of the Canary Islands, is a flowering plant native to the volcanic regions of Tenerife. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its twining stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in the early morning, hence its common name, and features vibrant blue or purple petals. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found growing along rocky outcrops. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens in tropical and subtropical climates.
